Sentencas: The effects of cobalt (Co) addition in the Ni-YSZ anode functional layer (AFL) on the structure and electrochemical performance of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are investigated.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction (XRD) analyses confirmed that the active metallic phase is a Ni1-xCox alloy under the operation conditions of the SOFC.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) observations indicate that the grain size of Ni1-xCox increases with increasing Co content.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Thermogravimetric analyses on the reduction of the Ni1-xCoxO-YSZ powders show that there are two processes: the chemicalreaction-controlled process and the diffusion-controlled process.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It is found that the reduction peak corresponding to the chemical-reaction-controlled process in the DTG curves moves toward lower temperatures with increasing Co content, suggesting that the catalytic activity of Ni1-xCox is enhanced by the doping of Co.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It is observed that the SOFC shows the best performance at x = 0.03, and the corresponding maximum power densities are 445, 651, and 815 mW cm(-2) at 700, 750, and 800 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The dependence of the SOFC performance on the Co content can be attributed to the competing results between the decreased three-phase-boundary length in the AFL and the enhanced catalytic activity of the Ni1-xCox phase with increasing Co content.
Titulo: Effects of Cobalt Addition on the Catalytic Activity of the Ni-YSZ Anode Functional Layer and the Electrochemical Performance of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
